metadata.title: CVE-2025-0241 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
When segmenting specially crafted text, segmentation would corrupt memoryleading to a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 134 and Firefox ESR < 128.6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2025-0241` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 134.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 134.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 134.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '134.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
